description: Coder agent: write, execute, and clean up Java (JBang) and Python code

steps.description: Context command — no LLM call needed

steps.userQuery: write a java program that calculates fibonacci numbers up to 20 and run it
steps.description: Coder writes Java code, executes via JBang, returns output

agentResponses.responseFallback: {"pass": true, "summary": "Coder wrote and executed Java fibonacci program via JBang"}

steps.userQuery: now clean up the temp file
steps.description: Coder deletes the temporary Java file

agentResponses.responseFallback:
I'll clean up the temporary file.

<tool_call>
{"name": "shell_exec", "args": {"command": "rm -f /tmp/Fibonacci.java && echo 'Cleaned up /tmp/Fibonacci.java'"}}
</tool_call>
{"pass": true, "summary": "Coder cleaned up temporary Java file"}

steps.userQuery: write a python script that generates a multiplication table for 1-5 and run it
steps.description: Coder writes Python code, executes it, returns output

agentResponses.responseFallback:
I'll write a Python script for a multiplication table and execute it.

<tool_call>
{"name": "write_file", "args": {"path": "/tmp/multable.py", "content": "#!/usr/bin/env python3

def multiplication_table(n):
    print(f'Multiplication Table (1-{n})')
    print('-' * 30)
    header = '   ' + ''.join(f'{i:4d}' for i in range(1, n+1))
    print(header)
    print('-' * 30)
    for i in range(1, n+1):
        row = f'{i:2d} |' + ''.join(f'{i*j:4d}' for j in range(1, n+1))
        print(row)

multiplication_table(5)
print('\nDone!')"}}
</tool_call>
{"pass": true, "summary": "Coder wrote and executed Python multiplication table script"}

steps.userQuery: clean up the python temp file too
steps.description: Coder deletes the temporary Python file

agentResponses.responseFallback:
I'll clean up the temporary Python file.

<tool_call>
{"name": "shell_exec", "args": {"command": "rm -f /tmp/multable.py && echo 'Cleaned up /tmp/multable.py'"}}
</tool_call>
{"pass": true, "summary": "Coder cleaned up temporary Python file"}

steps.userQuery: write a java program that fetches the current time from worldtimeapi.org and prints it, then run it and clean up
steps.description: Coder writes Java HTTP client, executes, cleans up — all in one step

agentResponses.responseFallback: {"delegate": "coder", "subTask": "write Java HTTP time fetcher, execute, and clean up"}
{"pass": true, "summary": "Coder wrote, executed, and cleaned up Java HTTP time fetcher"}
